list.head: WALTER REED & YELLOW FEVER. CHRONOLOGY OF THE YELLOW FEVER WORK IN CUBA, 1899 and 1900 AND PERSONAL EXPERIENCES.
list.item:
I arrived in Havana with 1st Div. 7th Army Corps of which I was Chief
Surgeon....................................................................Dec. 29, 1898
Became Chief Surgeon 7th Army Corps and Lieut Col Vols..................Feb. 11, 1899

Walter Reed came to Cuba to investigate typhoid epidemic in camp at Puerto
Principe...................................................................May 4 1899
Yellow fever epidemic in Santiago..........................................June & July "
Yellow fever at Marianao........................................ May, June July & Aug " 1900
General Leonard Wood supercedes Gen. Brooke as Gov. General of Cuba........Dec. 20, 1899
Gorgas suceeds Davis as Sanitary Office of City of Havana.................Feb. 10, 1900

Reed comes to Havana to investigate Electrozone Plant for making disin-
fectant out of sea water...................................................Mar. 10, 1900
Yellow Fever in Marianao......Major Edmonds died at 27 Lee St. June 16-..May & June "
Reed arrives in Cuba and came to see me the same day.......................June 25, 1900
Yellow Fever Board organised under S. O. 122. A. G. O. May 24, 1900 Wash. D. C.........June 26, 1900
Reed and Agramonte investigated yellow fever in camp at Pinar del Rio.....July 21, 1900

Reed Board takes up the Finlay theory of transmission of yellow fever by
mosquitoes for investigation....................................... about ...Aug. 1, 1900
Reed called back to United States by death of Dr. Shakespeare about........Aug. 7, 1900 X-PSH

First experiments by Board with mosquitoes - Dr. A.S. Pinto, members of
the Board and others bitten without result.................................Aug. 11, 1900
I returned to Havana from sick leave in U.S................................Aug. 13, 1900
Carroll bitten by infected mosquito........................................Aug. 27, 1900
Private Wm. H. Dean, Troop B., 7th Cav. (XY). bitten.......................Aug. 31, 1900
Lazear taken sick with yellow fever......................................Sept. 18, 1900

Reed returns from the U.S. about Matansas Oct. 3 Havana Oct. 4...........Oct. 3 4, 1900 my diary
VR to 184

Reed and I go to see General Wood to get approval of human experiments and
promise of assistance with money...........................................Oct. 12, 1900

I issue circular to Medical Officers, General Lee's command to begin
mosquito work..............................................................Oct. 15, 1900
Reed returns from the United States........................................Oct. 28, 1900

Colonel Havard, Chief Surgeon goes on leave and I become Acting C. Surg.
Department of Cuba.........................................................Nov. 19, 1900
Experiments with infected bedding begin.....................................Nov. 30, 1900

until Jan. 10, 1901, Dr. R.P. Cooke and others
Kissinger bitten by infected mosquito Nov. 20, Nov. 23 and.................Dec. 5, 1900

Gen. Order No. 6, Dept. Cuba, directing warfare on mosquitoes by medical
officers all stations......................................................Dec. 21, 1900

Dinner to Dr. Carlos Finlay, to celebrate the demonstration by Reed of his
theory.....................................................................Dec. 22, 1900

General Wood, Finlay, Reed, Gorgas and about 60 Cuban physicians there. I
sat on Dr. Finlay's right.
I left Havana for Washington for examination for promotion as Major..M.C...Jan. 30, 1901

item.p:
I talked to Gorgas just before leaving and urged him to join the rest of us
in accepting Reed's demonstration before the Pan American Med. Congress met in
Feb. He said that he believed that Reed had been able to cause it by the bites
of mosquitoes, but he did not believe that it was the only way, or even the
most usual way.

Reed's paper announcing the demonstration of transmission of yellow fever by
mosquito at Pan American Medical Congress held in Havana...................Feb. 4-7, 1901

list.item: Gorgas begins mosquito work in Havana.................................about Mar. 1 " or after

C. Surg. issues circular No. 5 Dept. of Cuba directing discontinuance
of disinfection for yellow fever...........................................Apr. 27 "
Carroll returns to Havana for experiments with filtered blood of y.f.......Aug. 11 "
Gorgas ceases disinfection bedding & clothing for yellow fever.............Aug. 15 "
